title: TSQCA Reproducible Code (English)
code: # Adjust the file name as needed library(TSQCA) data("sample_data") dat <- sample_data  # Outcome and conditions Yvar  <- "Y" Xvars <- c("X1", "X2", "X3")  # Quick inspection str(dat) #> 'data.frame':    80 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ Y : int  8 4 5 7 2 2 7 5 3 8 ... #>  $ X1: int  7 2 6 8 8 9 8 8 1 5 ... #>  $ X2: int  7 5 8 4 0 5 8 4 4 2 ... #>  $ X3: int  1 6 6 5 3 4 5 3 6 8 ... summary(dat) #>        Y                X1               X2              X3         #>  Min.   : 0.000   Min.   : 0.000   Min.   : 0.00   Min.   : 0.000   #>  1st Qu.: 3.000   1st Qu.: 3.000   1st Qu.: 3.00   1st Qu.: 3.000   #>  Median : 5.000   Median : 5.500   Median : 5.00   Median : 5.000   #>  Mean   : 5.513   Mean   : 5.237   Mean   : 5.05   Mean   : 4.925   #>  3rd Qu.: 7.250   3rd Qu.: 8.000   3rd Qu.: 7.25   3rd Qu.: 7.000   #>  Max.   :10.000   Max.   :10.000   Max.   :10.00   Max.   :10.000

title: TSQCA Reproducible Code (English)
code: thrY_base <- 7 thrX_base <- 7  # Fixed X thresholds (for OTS–QCA) thrX_vec <- c(   X1 = thrX_base,   X2 = thrX_base,   X3 = thrX_base ) thrX_vec #> X1 X2 X3  #>  7  7  7

title: TSQCA Reproducible Code (English)
text: Sweep single condition X (example: X3). Export:
code: sweep_var   <- "X3"   # 閾値を変化させる対象の条件（X） sweep_range <- 6:9    # 試す閾値候補 thrY         <- 7     # Y の閾値（固定） thrX_default <- 7     # その他 X の閾値（固定）  res_cts <- ctSweepS(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_var      = sweep_var,   sweep_range    = sweep_range,   thrY           = thrY,   thrX_default   = thrX_default,   return_details = FALSE ) #> title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: Threshold-Sweep QCA (TS-QCA) framework systematically exploring different threshold settings affect results crisp-set Qualitative Comparative Analysis (QCA). crisp-set QCA, researcher must choose thresholds binarize: outcome Y, conditions X. Small changes thresholds may lead substantial differences truth tables minimized solutions. TS-QCA provides: systematic way vary thresholds, transparent way evaluate sensitivity, reproducible workflow robustness assessment. TSQCA package implements four sweep methods:

title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: TS-QCA assumes: Data calibrated (e.g., 0–10 scale fuzzy-set values). Thresholds numeric (integer real). Missing values handled running sweeps. Example dataset structure: Define outcome conditions:
code: library(TSQCA) data("sample_data") dat <- sample_data str(dat) #> 'data.frame':    80 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ Y : int  8 4 5 7 2 2 7 5 3 8 ... #>  $ X1: int  7 2 6 8 8 9 8 8 1 5 ... #>  $ X2: int  7 5 8 4 0 5 8 4 4 2 ... #>  $ X3: int  1 6 6 5 3 4 5 3 6 8 ... Yvar  <- "Y" Xvars <- c("X1", "X2", "X3")

title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: CTS–QCA varies threshold one X condition, keeping others fixed.
code: sweep_var   <- "X3"   # 閾値を変化させる対象の条件（X） sweep_range <- 6:9    # 試す閾値候補  thrY         <- 7     # Y の閾値（固定） thrX_default <- 7     # その他 X の閾値（固定）  res_cts <- ctSweepS(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_var      = sweep_var,   sweep_range    = sweep_range,   thrY           = thrY,   thrX_default   = thrX_default,   return_details = FALSE ) #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(impmat = inputt, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(impmat = expressions, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(primes, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, curly = curly): Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(configs, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning: package 'QCA' was built under R version 4.4.3 #> Loading required package: admisc #> Warning: package 'admisc' was built under R version 4.4.3 #>  #> To cite package QCA in publications, please use: #>   Dusa, Adrian (2019) QCA with R. title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: sweep result contains: threshold values tested, minimized solution expression, solution consistency (inclS), solution coverage (covS). General guidance: Consistency ≥ 0.8 typically required sufficiency. Coverage indicates empirical relevance; higher better. solution sensitive small threshold changes suggests low robustness.

title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: TSQCA provides structured reproducible way evaluate threshold choices influence QCA results. Using CTS, MCTS, OTS, DTS sweeps, researchers can: assess robustness, identify stable causal patterns, detect threshold-sensitive relationships, strengthen QCA validity.

title: TSQCA Tutorial (English)
text: information TS-QCA methodology, see: Ragin, C. C. (2008). Redesigning Social Inquiry: Fuzzy Sets Beyond. University Chicago Press. DOI: 10.7208/chicago/9780226702797.001.0001 Duşa, . (2019). title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: TS-QCA（Threshold-Sweep QCA）は、crisp-set QCA においてアウトカム Y と条件 X の閾値設定が結果に与える影響を体系的に評価する ためのフレームワークです。 QCA はキャリブレーション後、設定した閾値に基づいて データを 0/1 の集合に分けます。 しかし、閾値が少し変わるだけで、Truth Table や最小化解が変化することがあります。 TS-QCA はその問題に対して、以下を自動実行します。 多数の閾値候補に基づくデータの二値化 Truth Table の生成 QCA::minimize() による最小化 解（式・整合性・被覆値）の抽出

title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: TSQCA パッケージでは、TS-QCA の4つのスイープ手法を実装しています。

title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: TS-QCA は、キャリブレーション済みデータ（例：0〜10 スケール）を想定しています。 閾値は数値（整数・実数）であれば構いません。 ※ 欠損値（NA）が含まれている場合、スイープ実行前に除去または補完を行ってください。
code: # Adjust the file name as needed library(TSQCA) data("sample_data") dat <- sample_data str(dat) #> 'data.frame':    80 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ Y : int  8 4 5 7 2 2 7 5 3 8 ... #>  $ X1: int  7 2 6 8 8 9 8 8 1 5 ... #>  $ X2: int  7 5 8 4 0 5 8 4 4 2 ... #>  $ X3: int  1 6 6 5 3 4 5 3 6 8 ...  Yvar  <- "Y" Xvars <- c("X1", "X2", "X3")

what: CTS–QCA（ctSweepS）：単一条件 X スイープ
title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: CTS–QCA は、1つの X 条件の閾値だけを変化させ、 Y とその他の X の閾値は固定したまま、結果の変化を確認する手法です。
code: sweep_var   <- "X3"   # 閾値を変化させる対象の条件（X） sweep_range <- 6:9    # 試す閾値候補  thrY         <- 7     # Y の閾値（固定） thrX_default <- 7     # その他 X の閾値（固定）  res_cts <- ctSweepS(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_var      = sweep_var,   sweep_range    = sweep_range,   thrY           = thrY,   thrX_default   = thrX_default,   return_details = FALSE ) #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(impmat = inputt, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(impmat = expressions, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(primes, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, curly = curly): Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(configs, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning: package 'QCA' was built under R version 4.4.3 #> Loading required package: admisc #> Warning: package 'admisc' was built under R version 4.4.3 #>  #> To cite package QCA in publications, please use: #>   Dusa, Adrian (2019) QCA with R. what: MCTS–QCA（ctSweepM）：複数条件 X スイープ
title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: MCTS–QCA は、複数の X 条件の閾値を同時に変化させ、 すべての組合せに対して QCA を実行する手法です。

        = 7,   return_details = FALSE ) #> Warning in admisc::writePrimeimp(impmat = inputt, mv = mv, collapse = collapse, : Function writePrimeimp() is deprecated, use writePIs(). #> Warning in id: otsqcaotsweepアウトカム-y-のスイープ
what: OTS–QCA（otSweep）：アウトカム Y のスイープ
title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: OTS–QCA は、アウトカム Y の閾値だけを変化させる手法です。 条件 X の閾値は固定したまま、Y の閾値の取り方が結果に与える影響を評価します。

title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: DTS–QCA は、X の閾値（複数条件）と Y の閾値を同時に変化させる 最も包括的なスイープ手法です。

title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: 各スイープ関数の出力には、概ね次の情報が含まれます。 どの閾値を用いたか（X または Y の閾値） その閾値のもとで得られた最小化解（expression） 解の整合性（inclS） 解の被覆値（covS） 一般的な解釈の目安： 整合性（inclS）がおおよそ 0.8 以上であれば、十分条件として望ましいとされることが多いです。 被覆値（covS）は、その解がどの程度のケースを説明できているか（実質的な影響力）を示します。 ※ 閾値をわずかに変えただけで最小化解が大きく変化する場合、 その結果は閾値設定に敏感であり、ロバスト性に課題があると判断できます。

title: TSQCA Tutorial (Japanese)
text: TSQCA を用いることで、QCA における閾値設定の影響を体系的に評価し、 分析結果のロバスト性を確認できます。 CTS / MCTS / OTS / DTS の各手法により、研究者は： 頑健な因果パターンの特定 閾値に敏感な結果の検出 分析全体の信頼性向上 を実現できます。

what: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
text: Japanese README TSQCA R package implementing Threshold-Sweep QCA (TS-QCA), framework systematically varying thresholds used binarize outcome conditions crisp-set QCA. calibration, QCA results may change depending thresholds set. TS-QCA evaluates sensitivity automatically: binarizing data using many threshold candidates generating truth tables applying QCA::minimize() extracting solution, consistency, coverage Implemented sweep types: CTS-QCA (ctSweepS): Sweep threshold one X MCTS-QCA (ctSweepM): Sweep thresholds multiple X conditions OTS-QCA (otSweep): Sweep threshold Y DTS-QCA (dtSweep): Sweep X Y thresholds simultaneously (2D sweep)

title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("your-account/TSQCA")

title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: library(QCA) library(TSQCA)  dat <- read.csv("sample_data.csv", fileEncoding = "UTF-8")  Yvar  <- "Y" Xvars <- c("X1", "X2", "X3")  str(dat)

title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: sweep_var <- "X3"      # Condition (X) whose threshold will be varied sweep_range <- 6:9     # Candidate threshold values  thrY <- 7              # Fixed threshold for Y thrX_default <- 7      # Fixed thresholds for other X's  res_cts <- ctSweepS(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_var      = sweep_var,      # X to sweep   sweep_range    = sweep_range,    # Threshold candidates for X   thrY           = thrY,           # Fixed Y threshold   thrX_default   = thrX_default,   # Fixed thresholds for other X's   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_cts)

title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: # Threshold candidates for each X sweep_list <- list(   X1 = 6:8,   X2 = 6:8,   X3 = 6:8 )  res_mcts <- ctSweepM(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_list     = sweep_list,     # Threshold candidates for each X   thrY           = 7,              # Fixed Y threshold   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_mcts)

title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: thrX <- c(X1 = 7, X2 = 7, X3 = 7)  # Fixed thresholds for X sweep_range_Y <- 6:9               # Candidate thresholds for Y  res_ots <- otSweep(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_range    = sweep_range_Y,  # Y threshold candidates   thrX           = thrX,           # Fixed X thresholds   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_ots)

what: 4. DTS-QCA: 2D sweep of X and Y (dtSweep)
title: Threshold Sweep Extensions for Qualitative Comparative Analysis
code: # X-side threshold candidates (multiple conditions) sweep_list_X <- list(   X1 = 6:8,   X2 = 6:8,   X3 = 6:8 )  # Y-side threshold candidates sweep_range_Y <- 6:8  res_dts <- dtSweep(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_list_X   = sweep_list_X,   # X threshold candidates   sweep_range_Y  = sweep_range_Y,  # Y threshold candidates   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_dts)

title: TSQCA（日本語版）
text: English README TSQCA は、Qualitative Comparative Analysis（QCA）に対して閾値スイープ型の分析（TS-QCA）を実行する R パッケージです。 キャリブレーション後の crisp-set QCA では、 アウトカム Y と条件 X の閾値設定が結果に大きく影響します。 TS-QCA は、多数の閾値候補を体系的に試しながら以下を自動実行します。 データの二値化 Truth Table の生成 QCA::minimize() による最小化 解の式・整合性・被覆値の抽出 実装されている手法： CTS–QCA（ctSweepS）：1つの X の閾値を変化 MCTS–QCA（ctSweepM）：複数の X の閾値を同時に変化 OTS–QCA（otSweep）：Y の閾値だけを変化 DTS–QCA（dtSweep）：X と Y の閾値を同時に変化（2次元スイープ）

title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("your-account/TSQCA")

title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: library(QCA) library(TSQCA)  dat <- read.csv("sample_data.csv", fileEncoding = "UTF-8")  Yvar  <- "Y" Xvars <- c("X1", "X2", "X3")  str(dat)

what: 1. CTS–QCA：単一条件 X スイープ（ctSweepS）
title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: sweep_var <- "X3"      # 閾値を変化させる対象の条件（X） sweep_range <- 6:9     # 試す閾値候補  thrY <- 7              # Y の閾値（固定） thrX_default <- 7      # その他 X の閾値（固定）  res_cts <- ctSweepS(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_var      = sweep_var,      # スイープ対象の X   sweep_range    = sweep_range,    # スイープする閾値   thrY           = thrY,           # Y の閾値   thrX_default   = thrX_default,   # その他 X の閾値   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_cts)

what: 2. MCTS–QCA：複数条件 X スイープ（ctSweepM）
title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: # X の各条件に対する閾値候補の指定 sweep_list <- list(   X1 = 6:8,   X2 = 6:8,   X3 = 6:8 )  res_mcts <- ctSweepM(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_list     = sweep_list,     # 各 X の閾値候補   thrY           = 7,              # Y の閾値（固定）   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_mcts)

title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: thrX <- c(X1 = 7, X2 = 7, X3 = 7)  # X の閾値（固定） sweep_range_Y <- 6:9               # Y の閾値候補  res_ots <- otSweep(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_range    = sweep_range_Y,  # Y の閾値候補   thrX           = thrX,           # 固定する X の閾値   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_ots)

title: TSQCA（日本語版）
code: # X 側の閾値候補（複数条件） sweep_list_X <- list(   X1 = 6:8,   X2 = 6:8,   X3 = 6:8 )  # Y 側の閾値候補 sweep_range_Y <- 6:8  res_dts <- dtSweep(   dat            = dat,   Yvar           = Yvar,   Xvars          = Xvars,   sweep_list_X   = sweep_list_X,   # X 側の閾値候補   sweep_range_Y  = sweep_range_Y,  # Y 側の閾値候補   return_details = FALSE )  head(res_dts)

text: MIT License.

title: MCTS–QCA: Multi-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepM
text: Performs grid search thresholds multiple X variables. combination thresholds sweep_list, outcome Y X variables binarized, crisp-set QCA executed.

title: MCTS–QCA: Multi-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepM
code: ctSweepM(   dat,   Yvar,   Xvars,   sweep_list,   thrY,   dir.exp = NULL,   include = "?",   incl.cut = 0.8,   n.cut = 2,   pri.cut = 0.5,   return_details = FALSE )

title: MCTS–QCA: Multi-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepM
text: dat Data frame containing outcome condition variables. Yvar Character. Outcome variable name. Xvars Character vector. Names condition variables. sweep_list Named list. element numeric vector candidate thresholds corresponding X. Names must match Xvars. thrY Numeric. Threshold Y (fixed). dir.exp Directional expectations minimize. NULL, set 1. include Inclusion rule minimize. incl.cut Consistency cutoff truthTable. n.cut Frequency cutoff truthTable. pri.cut PRI cutoff minimize. return_details Logical. TRUE, returns summary detailed objects.

title: MCTS–QCA: Multi-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepM
text: return_details = FALSE, data frame columns: combo_id — index threshold combination threshold — character string summarizing thresholds, e.g. "X1=6, X2=7, X3=7" expression — minimized solution expression inclS — solution consistency covS — solution coverage return_details = TRUE, list : summary — data frame details — per-combination list combo_id, thrX_vec, truth_table, solution

title: CTS–QCA: Single-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepS
text: Performs threshold sweep one focal condition X. threshold sweep_range, outcome Y X variables binarized using user-specified thresholds, crisp-set QCA executed.

title: CTS–QCA: Single-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepS
code: ctSweepS(   dat,   Yvar,   Xvars,   sweep_var,   sweep_range,   thrY,   thrX_default = 7,   dir.exp = NULL,   include = "?",   incl.cut = 0.8,   n.cut = 2,   pri.cut = 0.5,   return_details = FALSE )

title: CTS–QCA: Single-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepS
text: dat Data frame containing outcome condition variables. Yvar Character. Outcome variable name. Xvars Character vector. Names condition variables. sweep_var Character. Name condition swept. Must one Xvars. sweep_range Numeric vector. Candidate thresholds sweep_var. thrY Numeric. Threshold Y (fixed). thrX_default Numeric. Default threshold non-swept X variables. dir.exp Optional named numeric vector directional expectations minimize. NULL, set 1. include Inclusion rule minimize (e.g., "?"). incl.cut Consistency cutoff truthTable. n.cut Frequency cutoff truthTable. pri.cut PRI cutoff minimize. return_details Logical. TRUE, returns summary data frame detailed objects threshold.

title: CTS–QCA: Single-condition threshold sweep — ctSweepS
text: return_details = FALSE, data frame columns: threshold — swept threshold sweep_var expression — minimized solution expression inclS — solution consistency covS — solution coverage return_details = TRUE, list : summary — data frame details — per-threshold list threshold, thrX_vec, truth_table, solution

what: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep
title: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep
text: Sweeps thresholds multiple X variables outcome Y jointly. combination X thresholds candidate Y threshold, data binarized crisp-set QCA executed.

title: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep
code: dtSweep(   dat,   Yvar,   Xvars,   sweep_list_X,   sweep_range_Y,   dir.exp = NULL,   include = "?",   incl.cut = 0.8,   n.cut = 2,   pri.cut = 0.5,   return_details = FALSE )

title: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep
text: dat Data frame containing outcome condition variables. Yvar Character. Outcome variable name. Xvars Character vector. Names condition variables. sweep_list_X Named list. element numeric vector candidate thresholds corresponding X. sweep_range_Y Numeric vector. Candidate thresholds Y. dir.exp Directional expectations minimize. NULL, set 1. include Inclusion rule minimize. incl.cut Consistency cutoff truthTable. n.cut Frequency cutoff truthTable. pri.cut PRI cutoff minimize. return_details Logical. TRUE, returns summary detailed objects.

title: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep
text: return_details = FALSE, data frame columns: combo_id — index X-threshold combination thrY — threshold Y thrX — character label summarizing X thresholds expression — minimized solution expression inclS — solution consistency covS — solution coverage return_details = TRUE, list : summary — data frame details — list runs combo_id, thrY, thrX_vec, truth_table, solution

title: DTS–QCA: Two-dimensional X–Y threshold sweep — dtSweep

title: OTS–QCA: Outcome threshold sweep — otSweep

code: otSweep(   dat,   Yvar,   Xvars,   sweep_range,   thrX,   dir.exp = NULL,   include = "?",   incl.cut = 0.8,   n.cut = 2,   pri.cut = 0.5,   return_details = FALSE )

title: OTS–QCA: Outcome threshold sweep — otSweep
text: dat Data frame containing outcome condition variables. Yvar Character. Outcome variable name. Xvars Character vector. Names condition variables. sweep_range Numeric vector. Candidate thresholds Y. thrX Named numeric vector. Fixed thresholds X variables, names matching Xvars. dir.exp Directional expectations minimize. NULL, set 1. include Inclusion rule minimize. incl.cut Consistency cutoff truthTable. n.cut Frequency cutoff truthTable. pri.cut PRI cutoff minimize. return_details Logical. TRUE, returns summary detailed objects.
